dt: {bc}an animal of strange or terrifying shape

dt.t: … visualize this scaleless {wi}monster{/wi}, eight or nine feet long, sprawling in the shade by the side of the mud pools …
That's why I was born in my grandmother's house—a grand, brick {d_link|Federal|federal} {wi}monster{/wi} of a house.

dt: {bc}an animal or plant of abnormal form or structure
{bc}one who deviates from normal or acceptable behavior or character

dt.t: the same {wi}monster{/wi}—Destiny … that rolls every civilization to doom

dt: {bc}a person of unnatural or extreme ugliness, deformity, wickedness, or cruelty

dt.t: That movie was a {wi}monster{/wi} at the box office.

et: Middle English {it}monstre{/it}, from Anglo-French, from Latin {it}monstrum{/it} omen, monster, from {it}monēre{/it} to warn {ma}{mat|mind|}{/ma}
shortdef: an animal of strange or terrifying shape
one unusually large for its kind
an animal or plant of abnormal form or structure

dt: {bc}a large, stout, venomous lizard ({it}Heloderma suspectum{/it}) that has rough, bumpy, black and orange, pinkish, or yellowish skin, a thick tail, and venom glands in the lower lip and that is found especially in arid regions of the southwestern U.S. and northwestern Mexico

shortdef: a large, stout, venomous lizard (Heloderma suspectum) that has rough, bumpy, black and orange, pinkish, or yellowish skin, a thick tail, and venom glands in the lower lip and that is found especially in arid regions of the southwestern U.S. and northwestern Mexico

dt: {bc}{d_link|jealousy|jealousy} imagined as a monster that attacks people

dt.t: Finally, he suffered from professional jealousy, although, at least in public, he kept the {wi}green-eyed monster{/wi} at bay most of the time.
Can it be that Suzanne was envious because you had a date? It sounds as if the {wi}green-eyed monster{/wi} may have taken over and clouded her judgment.

shortdef: jealousy imagined as a monster that attacks people —usually used with the

dt: {bc}a large, long-necked creature that has long been reported to exist in the waters of {d_link|Loch Ness|Ness, Loch:g} in Scotland

dt.t: The {wi}Loch Ness Monster{/wi} has baffled scientists for centuries, but a new group of experts are now hoping modern technology will reveal what really lives in the murky depths of the Scottish lake.
… gave up his job, house and girlfriend to launch an epic hunt for the {wi}Loch Ness Monster{/wi}.

Seeking to end the {lsquo}stigma{rsquo} of research on Scotland's Loch Ness, UK biologists last week announced a new project to explore the lake, which, as well as being the legendary home of {lsquo}Nessie{rsquo}, the {wi}Loch Ness monster{/wi}, is the UK's largest body of fresh water.

shortdef: a large, long-necked creature that has long been reported to exist in the waters of Loch Ness in Scotland

dt: {bc}a person known for frequent often wild partying {bc}{sx|party animal||}

dt.t: Listen up, {wi}party monsters{/wi}. There's no need to spend the festive season in bed with a throbbing head.
"They were bringing back those 'Disco 2000' vibes," a clubgoer told us—referring to {wi}party monster{/wi} Michael Alig's notorious Wednesday-night party at Limelight in the '90s.

shortdef: a person known for frequent often wild partying : party animal
